resources.string: "With help from the sun a glass bottle can potentially start a wildfire, which can quickly evolve into a forest fire. \n\nMake sure you always bring your rubbish home!"

"When using a disposable grill you should always make sure that it is placed on an even and non-flammable surface. \n\nMake sure that it is properly put out, and always dispose of it in a container specifically made for disposable grills."
"Did you know lightning is one of the main causes of forest fires in Norway? It can linger in the ground for up to three days before igniting. \n\nAlways CALL 110 if you witness any sign of fire!"

"Using tools that has an open flame, or create sparks can be very dangerous. It is important to take precautions when dealing with these kind of tools. \n\nAlways make an assessment before using them, and if there is a high danger index, postpone it!"
"Make sure you always use a custom made container to throw away your used and unlit disposable grills. \n\nYou can often find useful maps of these containers on official council websites."

"Between the 15th of April and the 15th of September it is prohibited to light a campfire, bbq or a disposable grill in or in close proximity to a forest.\n\nWhen lighting a fire you should always make sure to properly put it out before leaving it"

"
The numbers indicating the danger index are provided by The Norwegian Meteorological Institute, and are calculated with regards to rainfall, humidity and temperature. 

It is important to be extra cautious when the index signals a high risk."
Low danger 0 to 29. Medium danger 30 to 60. High danger over 60
slide to the right to include warning for lower danger index
This application requires internet access to function. Please make sure you have an internet connection and try again.
Descriptive image filling top of page
